html:
Canon’s PowerShot series has stayed a favorite for the seasoned, newbies, and the good ol’ enthusiasts. Covering the enduring classics and a much-awaited upcoming release, we’ve narrowed it down to our top 5!

1. Canon PowerShot G7 X Mark III

The Vlogger’s Vanguard

While a statement from Canon Japan confirms that they have currently suspended orders until resumption it still remains a stalwart in the compact camera arena, particularly favored by content creators and vloggers. Despite being launched almost 6 years ago (and on the verge of being discontinued), the G7 X Mark III is nicknamed ‘TikTok Favorite Camera’ for its pocket-sized body, and stellar capabilities, especially in video recording and low-light photography, make it a worthy contender. 

Key Features

  • Sensor: 20.1MP 1.0-inch stacked CMOS
  • Lens: 24-100mm (4.2x optical zoom), f/1.8-2.8
  • Video: 4K up to 30p, Full HD up to 120p
  • Connectivity: Wi-Fi, Bluetooth
  • Display: 3.0-inch tilting touchscreen

Drawbacks  

  • 4k video not available in all modes
  • Discontinued 
  • The lens is not as sharp
  • Face detection doesn’t work while Burst Shooting 

Current Market Price: Approx USD 700+

2. Canon PowerShot SX70 HS

The Zoom Zealot’s Dream

For those who believe that distance makes the heart grow fonder, this beauty brings those far views up close and personal. Unfortunately, the end date nears for this model too, as it’s announced to be discontinued in 2028.

Having said that, it doesn’t take away the fact that it’s a brilliant work of art by Canon. The SX70 HS is a bridge camera that offers DSLR-like handling with the convenience of a fixed lens. 

Key Features

  • Sensor: 20.3MP 1/2.3-inch CMOS
  • Lens: 21-1365mm (65x optical zoom), f/3.4-6.5
  • Video: 4K up to 30p
  • Connectivity: Wi-Fi, Bluetooth
  • Display: 3.0-inch vari-angle LCD

Drawbacks

  • High price
  • Focusing issues
  • No touch-screen
  • No auto HDR option

Current Market Price: Approx USD 500+

The New Kid on the Block

Canon’s recent introduction, the PowerShot V1, is tailored for vloggers and content creators, highlighting video capabilities without taking away the limelight on stills. For now, it is only available in Asia. The V1 is stacked with advanced autofocus, subject tracking, and unique “moods” for video customization. The camera comes with movie scene/portrait modes for all those close-up demos, while smoothing your skin. To add to that, it is also fashionable, compact, and effective making it an absolute favorite among creators on social media.

Key Features

  • Sensor: 22.3MP Type 1.4 CMOS
  • Lens: 16-50mm (3x optical zoom), f/2.8-4.5
  • Video: 4K up to 60p
  • Connectivity: Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, USB-C
  • Display: 3.0-inch vari-angle touchscreen

Drawbacks

  • No built-in viewfinder
  • Availability 
  • Poor Tele-zoom
  • No Weather Sealing 

Current Market Price: Approx USD 900+

4. Canon PowerShot G5 X Mark II

The Compact Powerhouse

The perfect combination of performance and portability makes it a favorite among shutterbugs looking for excellence without the heft. Although discontinued, the G5 X Mark II is still a desired Canon model. Its fast lens and phenomenal zoom range make it absolutely versatile for shooting in different scenarios. 

Key Features

  • Sensor: 20.1MP 1.0-inch stacked CMOS
  • Lens: 24-120mm (5x optical zoom), f/1.8-2.8
  • Video: 4K up to 30p
  • Connectivity: Wi-Fi, Bluetooth
  • Display: 3.0-inch tilting touchscreen

Drawbacks

  • Lens at wider apertures
  • 4K videos 
  • Battery life 
  • High price tag

Current Market Price: Approx USD 800+

5. Canon PowerShot V3 (Upcoming)

The Anticipated Successor

Rumors are buzzing about Canon’s potential release of the PowerShot V3, a model that promises to level up the series with some remarkable features. While almost everything is speculation currently, the PowerShot V3 is anticipated to build upon the V1’s foundation with much-improved performance and features to cater to the evolving needs of creators across social media platforms. 

Anticipated Features

  • Sensor: Approximately 24MP, likely larger than 1-inch
  • Lens: Expected versatile zoom range
  • Video: 4K capabilities with advanced stabilization
  • Connectivity: Enhanced wireless options
  • Display: Articulating touchscreen

Expected Market Price: Approx USD 1000+

Quick Comparison of the Best Canon PowerShot Cameras

The Future of Canon PowerShot Cameras

With the anticipated release of the V3 on the horizon and consistent innovations in compact camera technology, it’s a sure sign that the series is here to stay for the foreseeable future. There’s a perfect PowerShot model that’s made for you to help explore your creative possibilities be it professionally or just as an enthusiast.

Final Thoughts: Which Is the Best Canon PowerShot Camera?

Choosing the best Canon PowerShot camera in 2025 depends on you, as always. If you’re a vlogger, the Canon PowerShot G7 X Mark III is a solid bet. If zoom range is your priority, the Canon PowerShot SX70 HS is unmatched. Content creators will love the Canon PowerShot V1, while enthusiasts looking for a compact yet powerful camera should check out the Canon PowerShot G5 X Mark II. And if you have the patience to wait just a tad bit more, the Canon PowerShot V3 might be the benchmark of point-and-shoot innovation.

FAQs 

Which Canon PowerShot Camera Is Best for Beginners?

The Canon PowerShot G7 X Mark III is an excellent choice for beginners for its user-friendly interface along with top-quality video and photo capabilities.

What Is the Best Canon PowerShot Camera for Video?

The Canon PowerShot V1 is designed for content creators, offering 4K at 60fps, great autofocus, and enhanced connectivity features.

What’s the Best Canon PowerShot Camera for Travel?

The Canon PowerShot G5 X Mark II is the ideal travel camera due to its compact size, solid zoom range, and high image quality.

Are Canon PowerShot Cameras Still Worth Buying?

Absolutely! They are one of the best compact cameras currently in the market, offering a balance of performance, portability, and affordability.
